verses.text: Hearken, my servant Peter, and listen to the words of Jesus Christ, your Lord and your Redeemer.

similars.text: Hearken, O ye Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he hath commanded me that I should speak concerning you, for, behold he commandeth me that I should write, saying:
Give ear, O Lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.
Hear my prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.
Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me: Lord, be thou my helper.
Go thou near, and hear all that the Lord our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that the Lord our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.
Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.
Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

verses.text: For behold, I speak unto you with sharpness and with power, for mine arm is over all the earth.

similars.text: As I live, saith the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with fury poured out, will I rule over you:
With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are upon the ground, by my great power and by my outstretched arm, and have given it unto whom it seemed meet unto me.
Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
And thou say in thine heart, My power and the might of mine hand hath gotten me this wealth.
And I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your heaven as iron, and your earth as brass:
And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto me.
And in very deed for this cause have I raised thee up, for to shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;

verses.text: And I will tell you that which no man knoweth save me and thee alone--

similars.text: All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him.
For I determined not to know any thing among you, save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.
And now behold, my brethren, what natural man is there that knoweth these things? I say unto you, there is none that knoweth these things, save it be the penitent.
For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be?
Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and shew thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it.
For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.

And whatsoever thing persuadeth men to do good is of me; for good cometh of none save it be of me. I am the same that leadeth men to all good; he that will not believe my words will not believe me--that I am; and he that will not believe me will not believe the Father who sent me. For behold, I am the Father, I am the light, and the life, and the truth of the world.
For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.

And this is the means whereby salvation cometh. And there is none other salvation save this which hath been spoken of; neither are there any conditions whereby man can be saved except the conditions which I have told you.

verses.text: For many times you have desired of me to know that which would be of the most worth unto you.

similars.text: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.
Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.
That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.
Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;
But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.

And now my sons, behold I have somewhat more to desire of you, which desire is, that ye may not do these things that ye may boast, but that ye may do these things to lay up for yourselves a treasure in heaven, yea, which is eternal, and which fadeth not away; yea, that ye may have that precious gift of eternal life, which we have reason to suppose hath been given to our fathers.
Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.
For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;
These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

verses.text: Behold, blessed are you for this thing, and for speaking my words which I have given unto you according to my commandments.

similars.text: For behold, as yet, ye have been obedient unto the word of the Lord, which I have given unto you.

And when the disciples had done this, Jesus said unto them: Blessed are ye for this thing which ye have done, for this is fulfilling my commandments, and this doth witness unto the Father that ye are willing to do that which I have commanded you.
Behold, I have given unto you the commandments; therefore keep my commandments. And this is the law and the prophets, for they truly testified of me.
And now I have spoken the words which the Lord God hath commanded me.
And I give unto you a commandment that ye shall do these things. And if ye shall always do these things blessed are ye, for ye are built upon my rock.
My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.
And now the Lord shew kindness and truth unto you: and I also will requite you this kindness, because ye have done this thing.
Therefore blessed are ye if ye shall keep my commandments, which the Father hath commanded me that I should give unto you.

And now my beloved brethren, I have spoken these words unto you according to the Spirit which testifieth in me; and my soul doth exceedingly rejoice, because of the exceeding diligence and heed which ye have given unto my word.
And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

verses.text: And now, behold, I say unto you, that the thing which will be of the most worth unto you will be to declare repentance unto this people, that you may bring souls unto me, that you may rest with them in the kingdom of my Father. Amen.

similars.text: And I soon go to the place of my rest, which is with my Redeemer; for I know that in him I shall rest. And I rejoice in the day when my mortal shall put on immortality, and shall stand before him; then shall I see his face with pleasure, and he will say unto me: Come unto me, ye blessed, there is a place prepared for you in the mansions of my Father. Amen.
And also the Spirit saith unto me, yea, crieth unto me with a mighty voice, saying: Go forth and say unto this people--Repent, for except ye repent ye can in nowise inherit the kingdom of heaven.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, when these things shall be made known unto them of the Father, and shall come forth of the Father, from them unto you;
And the Lord said unto me, Arise, take thy journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give unto them.
And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
And now, my brethren, I would that ye should humble yourselves before God, and bring forth fruit meet for repentance, that ye may also enter into that rest.
And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.

Therefore, whoso repenteth and cometh unto me as a little child, him will I receive, for of such is the kingdom of God. Behold, for such I have laid down my life, and have taken it up again; therefore repent, and come unto me ye ends of the earth, and be saved.
Therefore may God grant unto you, my brethren, that ye may begin to exercise your faith unto repentance, that ye begin to call upon his holy name, that he would have mercy upon you;

And it shall come to pass, that whoso repenteth and is baptized in my name shall be filled; and if he endureth to the end, behold, him will I hold guiltless before my Father at that day when I shall stand to judge the world.
